IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To promote philanthropy and improve the quality of life for residents of Berks County.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To promote philanthropy and improve the quality of life for residents of Berks County.
IRS990.Description: Berks County Community Foundation helps people find the best way to make charitable gifts to support their community. The Community Foundation manages more than 369 different funds, each established with a specific purpose determined by the original donor. Some donors have decided it is best to leave the use of funds to the discretion of the Community Foundation Board. In this way, the Community Foundation can remain flexible and responsive to community needs.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Generally direct lobbying around three issues: a. Issues affecting community foundations, much of which is "self defense" b. Lobbying on behalf of municipal reforms in PA c. Lobbying county government for appropriations to various program areas (not through the Foundation).

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Community Foundation helps individuals, families and businesses find the best way to make charitable gifts that support causes or organizations they care about. The goal is to develop a charitable giving strategy that fulfills their personal objectives and makes the most sense financially. The Foundation makes grants from the endowment funds in support of its mission to promote philanthropy and improve the quality of life for the residents of Berks County.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Foundation accounts for uncertain tax positions in accordance with the "Income Taxes" topic ASC 740, formerly issued as FASB Interpretation No. 48, "Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes - an Interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109." ASC 740 prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for financial statements recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return and also provides guidance on various related matters such as derecognition, interest, penalties and disclosures required. The Foundation recognizeds interest and penalties, if any, related to unrecognized tax benefits in tax expense.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: handicap ramp, stairlift, handicapped equipped van & van conversions, shower commode chair & gait trainer

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grantees who receive a grant for anything other than general operating support are required to enter into a grant agreement with the Foundation. Through the grant agreement the organization acknowledge that the funds will be spent as specified in the grant agreement. A follow-up grant evaluation report is required to be submitted to the Foundation. Failure to submit the report by the specified date results in a loss of consideration for future grant dollars.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Foundation's Audit Committee's primary function is to assist the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities relating to monitoring the quality, reliability and integrity of the external financial reporting process this includes the audited financial statements as well as the IRS Form 990. The Audit Committee reviews both documents and will make a recommendation to the Board as to whether the Board should approve the Audit.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually all board members, committee members as well as staff are required to complete a Conflict of Interest Form. Completed forms are submitted to the Governance Committee. One of the Governance Committee's roles is to annually review the Conflict of Interest forms submitted and make any necessary disclosures if a conflict is noted.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The compensation of the President of The Community Foundation is reviewed and determined annually by the Executive Committee of the Board. The committee meets in executive session without staff present. They review the established performance objectives and results of the president. In addition, the committee reviews industry compensation data provided by the Council on Foundations as well as comparable local data provided periodically by a regional human resources consulting firm. In addition, the committee reviews the recent forms 990 for a variety of local organizations and other community foundations deemed to be a peer group. After reviewing that material, the executive committee establishes a compensation level that is designed to recognize current market conditions and performance in the position.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Foundation has an open book policy of disclosure of information to the public. All board members, committee members and staff members are aware of the Foundation's conflict of interest policy as they are required to annually, read the policy and complete a questionnaire as to any conflicts they may have. These forms are reviewed by the Foundation's Governance Committee and if necessary, disclosure of any noted conflict is made to the Board, committee, staff and if necessary disclosed in the Foundation's audited financial statements. Governing documents are made available to any one who asks for them. All fund agreements reference the governing documents and are provided to anyone who requests a copy. Audited financial statements and Form 990 are available to the public immediately after they are completed on the Foundation's website.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, Part IV, Line 12 & 990, AND Page 12, Part XI, Line 2b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Foundation answered No to having audited statements under GAAP performed by an independent auditor because a consolidated audit was performed. This 990 includes only the Foundation's activity and the supporting organizations file separate tax returns. The audit was performed and Combined statements were issued which is what the reconciliation on for Schedule D, Page 4 is being compared to.
